meanings.definition: Consisting of only one type or species.
meanings.sent1: The monotypic flower garden only had one type of flower.
meanings.sent2: The zoo's monotypic exhibit featured only one species of bird.
meanings.sent3: It was quite monotypic to see a classroom with only one type of book.
meanings.sent4: The monotypic forest stood out in its uniformity among the diverse landscapes.
meanings.sent5: The monotypic painting showcased the artist's focus on a single subject.

meanings.definition: Belonging to a single type or category.
meanings.sent1: The monotypic car collection consisted solely of vintage vehicles.
meanings.sent2: Her wardrobe was monotypic, filled with only black clothing.
meanings.sent3: It was a monotypic menu, offering only one type of pizza.
meanings.sent4: The monotypic library section contained books from a single genre.
meanings.sent5: The room's monotypic decor gave it a unique and cohesive look.
